Description: A necklace or bracelet: consisting of a large barrel bead of green feldspar, and four barrels (one short), two cylinders and a pendant of raw red Kaolinite, i.e. of natural hardened fine clay (not hardened by firing) coloured with red iron oxide. The three standard barrels, one of the cylinders and the pendant have very wide borings. The pendant would be a short barrel bead if the boring were not off-centre. These beads were originally threaded on fibres.
Curator's comments: The beads were in the region of the neck or hands of a disturbed female burial. Also from this burial: necklace or bracelet (1929,1015.253). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 41, 60; pl.XXII, 37 (pendant not shown); Grave register, pl.IX; Bead corpus, pl. XXXIX, 75Q8. 78B16; 79B4; 82C2; 86B3.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (51)
